title: Homemade Dumplings Recipe (with Video)
description: These homemade dumplings are light, fluffy, and tender. They're quick and easy to make and delicious in chicken soup and stews.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Main Dishes Dumpling Recipes Homemade Dumplings 4.7 (1,786) 1,479 Reviews 246 Photos My mother was one of the best cooks I ever knew. Whenever she made stews we mostly found homemade dumplings in them. We never ate things from packages and you sure could taste what food was! That's the way I continue to cook today. Submitted by Carol Updated on March 4, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 246 246 246 246 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 6 dumplings Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Have a hankering for light, fluffy, tender dumplings just like your mom used to make? You've come to the right place. These homemade dumplings are easy to make with just six pantry staples – and they're even easier to eat. With this top-rated recipe, you'll make perfect dumplings every time. What Are Dumplings? A dumpling is a small mass of dough that can be boiled, fried, baked, or steamed. There are a ton of dumpling varieties out there, from pork- and cabbage-filled Chinese dumplings to cheesy Polish dumplings. These boiled drop dumplings, which are popular in the U.S., are often paired with chicken and broth to create a popular comfort food called chicken and dumplings. They're prepared by dropping spoonfuls of dough into a pot of boiling soup or stew. The starch in the dumplings thickens the broth, resulting in a rich stew that's impossible to resist. Dumpling Ingredients This recipe is made with just six ingredients you probably already have on hand. FlourThese dumplings start with all-purpose flour, which creates structure and holds the other ingredients together. Baking PowderBaking powder is a leavening agent, which means it releases gas that makes the dough expand. It's responsible for the dumplings' light and fluffy texture. White SugarA teaspoon of sugar adds an extremely subtle hint of sweetness. It also helps the dumplings retain their moisture through the cooking process and slows gluten development, which ensures tender dumplings. SaltA pinch of salt seasons the dumplings and enhances the flavors of the other ingredients. Butter or MargarineCold butter or margarine is cut into the flour mixture to bind the dry ingredients together. It also keeps the dumplings light and tender. MilkWhole milk helps create a smooth, moist dough. How to Tell When Dumplings Are Done To make sure a dumpling is done cooking, pierce it with a fork or toothpick. You'll know it's done when the fork or toothpick comes out clean. How to Store Dumplings You can store leftover cooked dumplings or dumpling soup in an airtight container in the fridge for two to three days. Reheat gently on the stove or in 10-second intervals in the microwave. How to Freeze Dumplings Some people like to freeze dumpling dough for quick and easy cooking. It couldn't be easier: Just drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet, flash freeze for at least three hours or up to overnight, then transfer the now-frozen dough to a freezer-safe container or zip-top bag. Label with the date and freeze for about three months. When it's time to use them, let the dumplings thaw for about 30 minutes and then drop them directly into the soup or stew. Our 15 Best Dumpling Recipes of All Time Are Little Bundles of Joy Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "I have made the same old dumplings for years," says LIZ1888. "I came upon this recipe and tried it. These were great! I made them for chicken and dumplings. They also thickened the sauce as they cooked." "The dumplings came out so light and fluffy and flavorful," according to ALISON K. "I was searching for a dumpling recipe made from scratch instead of a mix and was so happy to find this one." "I topped a vegetable stew with these dumplings on a chilly autumn evening in Wisconsin," says Pam Westfall "Oh yum! Truly delicious. The perfect comfort food!" Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 cup all-purpose flour 2 teaspoons baking powder 1 teaspoon white sugar ½ teaspoon salt 1 tablespoon butter or margarine ½ cup milk Directions Gather the ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir together flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt in a bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Stir in milk and mix until a batter forms that is thick enough to be scooped with a spoon. Allow batter to rest for 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Drop batter by spoonfuls into boiling stew or soup. Cover and simmer without lifting the lid for 15 minutes. Serve. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS Cook’s Note To make parsley dumplings, add 1 tablespoon parsley flakes to the dry ingredients.For a finer consistency, sift the flour mixture. I Made It Print 3,436 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Homemade Dumplings 01 of 246 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS 02 of 246 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02/19/2025 Easy to follow A keeper! Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Great flavors Will be doing it again soon. 03 of 246 Photo by  ZippyMalt5689 10/29/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Worth the effort Family favorite Delicious! Everthing bout these dumplings was 5 star! The taste, texture, everything. 04 of 246 Photo by  Joy Clark Murray 05/30/2024 A keeper! Delicious, made with pulled chicken breast cooked in chicken broth and a can of cream of chicken soup and seasonings. 05 of 246 Photo by  TackyHerb1860 03/14/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Perfect in every way. 06 of 246 Photo by  MintMango1640 01/28/2024 I was out of bisquick and didn't know, and a quick google search pulled this up first. Super easy and super yummy! Turned out perfectly fluffy! Will not be using bisquick anymore! 07 of 246 Photo by  AquaMixer9930 01/13/2024 Simple recipe to make! I eliminated the sugar and added some Parmesan cheese, and they turned out great 08 of 246 Photo by  GreenTaco9713 01/03/2024 They are looking & smelling great! I'll come back with an update when the grandboys get in and try them!Well I'm back to tell you that they were a hit! So delicious! James said, "Grandmom, when I finish this bowl can I come back for just a couple dumpings?"... This is now my "go to" dumping recipe! Thank You! 09 of 246 Photo by  SillyPeas9464 12/20/2023 This was a pretty decent recipe, but the only 2 issue I had were the dumplings & too much celery. The dumplings were very ‘wet’. I made a 2nd batch and I cooked them longer thinking it would help and it didn’t.. 10 of 246 Photo by  HardySquid9819 11/25/2023 I substituted gluten-free A P flour for the regular flour. I also used half heavy cream and half milk. I also had to add about a quarter cup more milk as gluten-free flour is more thirsty.
